intro: Enicosanthum daclacense, commonly known as the Dacalac wildflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and requires a cool, moist environment to thrive. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple center. Due to habitat loss, Enicosanthum daclacense is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
